definition: sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: RARELY has a central bank been lambasted so loudly by so many.
sentences.chinese: 很少有一家央行宛如过街老鼠人人喊打。

sentences.english: Because Wang Fa report, bass and the giant became a rat crossing the street.
sentences.chinese: 因为王发的告发，刘利和擎天成了过街老鼠。

sentences.english: In recent years, performance management has become an object of hatred, people cry.
sentences.chinese: 最近两年，绩效管理成了过街老鼠，人人喊打。

sentences.english: He can only find a local shelter, just like such as "mice on the streets."
sentences.chinese: 他唯有另觅地方栖身，俨然如“过街老鼠”。

definition: stinking reputation/notorious far and wide
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
lit. when a rat crosses the street, people chase it down (idiom)/fig. everyone detests a lowlife
pinyin: lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3

definition: to spit on and curse/to revile
public enemy
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to spurn/to disdain
to have a bad reputation
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
nowhere to hide
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
